image.altText: the exterior of a historic school building

props.synopsis: One of Brisbane's most exclusive girls' private schools is facing legal action from a former student alleging she was sexually abused by a former staff member in the 1980s.

title.children: Past student launches legal action against Brisbane Girls Grammar School over child sex abuse allegations

image.altText: A heat map of the Earth on July 11, 2023.

props.synopsis: Between November 2022 and October this year, the average global temperature was more than 1.3 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels, and more record highs are on the way.

title.children: Mapping the world’s hottest 12 months

image.altText: A man in a black t-shirt with close cropped grey hair stands behind a white picket fence.

props.synopsis: Adam Kneale will receive from the Western Bulldogs what lawyers are describing as the largest jury payout awarded to a sexual abuse survivor.

title.children: Western Bulldogs to appeal after 'biggest' sexual abuse compensation win in Australian history

image.altText: people walking outside a store

props.synopsis: Telecommunications experts warn Australia’s major mobile providers are vulnerable to another major outage due to gradual cost-cutting and a critical lack of regulation.

title.children: 'Unacceptable': Experts say Optus coverage outage could happen again

image.altText: a man in a lue suit with a red bear holding a coke, walking outside court

props.synopsis: Shannon James Finemore was walking home with a friend in Fortitude Valley following a night of celebrations in 2020. But he never made it home.

title.children: 'Who would do this to my child?': Queensland duo jailed for fatal Melbourne Cup day attack

image.altText: A man with short brown hair and in a red shirt sits at a desk with his hands crossed.

props.synopsis: Don Brown made a post on his Facebook page in June 2020, stating his opposing candidate was only calling for the borders to open during the pandemic "because she owns a travel agency".

title.children: Queensland Labor MP ordered to pay $50,000 in damages to LNP rival over defamatory border closure comments

image.altText: Debbie Hatumale-Uy standing in front of boxes stacked in a warehouse.

props.synopsis: Optus will provide eligible customers, including small businesses, 200GB of free data as compensation for its nationwide outage that lasted for more than 12 hours and impacted more than 10 million Australians.

title.children: 'They're not listening to us': Business owner outraged by Optus data offer after outage

image.altText: O'Neil has a concerned expression, hand to mouth, while she looks towards Albanese.

props.synopsis: With the Coalition on his right and a High Court ruling and the Greens on his left, Anthony Albanese finds himself in a fraught political position that could prove catastrophic to his government, writes Brett Worthington.

title.children: In just 16 minutes, the High Court made a decision that put Albanese in a tight spot

image.altText: A leg ham with a sticker labelling the sale price at $96.50 at a supermarket in the Torres Strait.

props.synopsis: A union-backed probe hears Cape York residents are paying exorbitant prices for meat, and up to $2.87 a litre for diesel, while a retired nurse has been forced to go without insurance to make ends meet.

title.children: Union's price gouging inquiry hears some Queenslanders paying nearly $100 for a leg of ham

image.altText: Police swarm on a man lying on the ground in bushland, as seen from above.

props.synopsis: A string of shootings early this morning sparked a manhunt that ended with two arrests on the NSW Mid North Coast this afternoon. Police are continuing to investigate a potential link to a body found near the scene of one of the offences.

title.children: Pair arrested after NSW shooting spree, police treating man's death as suspicious

image.altText: A man in a suit walks down a staircase.

props.synopsis: A Perth man who fatally injured his 28-day old daughter had previous convictions for assaulting a former partner, a court hears.

title.children: Perth father who killed baby daughter in 'moment of madness' had domestic violence convictions

image.altText: Jacqui Lambie, David Pocock sitting next to each other during Senate Question Time.

props.synopsis: The federal government's attempt to make a raft of major changes to industrial relations laws this year looks set to fail, after some of the crossbench secured support for a different approach.

title.children: Lambie and Pocock split government's workplace relations bill in the Senate

image.altText: Multiple images of Meg Lanning in an Australia cricket uniform.

props.synopsis: Meg Lanning's record as an unflappable Australian skipper will stand the test of time, but the legacy she leaves for women's sport will make meaningful change now.

title.children: Why Australia's greatest captain acknowledges her greatest disappointment as the key moment of her career

image.altText: A man in a colourful shirt plays the melodica

props.synopsis: The composers of Blueback, Bluey and Deadloch are among the winners of this year's Screen Music Awards. The annual awards celebrate excellence in composition across Australia's small and large screens.

title.children: Composers of Bluey, Blueback and Deadloch among winners at the 2023 Screen Music Awards

image.altText: A submarine rests in a dock, crews of people walking on its surface, and an American flag planted at its bow.

props.synopsis: The first newly built nuclear-powered submarine can be expected to be sold to Australia in 2038, according to a senior US naval officer, with second-hand boats likely to be sold earlier in the decade.

title.children: US admiral reveals when Australia will receive first nuclear-powered submarine under AUKUS

image.altText: Dominic Gaynor arrives at court wearing a suit and sunglasses

props.synopsis: A Sydney police officer who pointed his gun towards a colleague after warning him not to reveal spoilers about the movie Top Gun: Maverick is handed a two-year good behaviour bond and a conviction.

title.children: Sydney cop sentenced for pointing gun towards colleague over spoilers for Tom Cruise movie

image.altText: A woman in a family photo with other faces blurred.

props.synopsis: Jade Elizabeth Harrington has launched legal action against Queensland Health for allegedly unnecessarily removing her gall bladder and misdiagnosing a life-threatening complication of bariatric surgery on five occasions.

title.children: 'My husband even needs to assist me with showering': Brisbane mum sues Queensland Health and gastric surgeon for alleged negligence

image.altText: Laura Enever with her WorldRecord certificate

props.synopsis: Laura Enever used to compete on the World Surf League Championship Tour before quitting to try big wave surfing. Now she's a world record holder.

title.children: Aussie breaks world record by paddling in to surf 13-metre wave

image.altText: A young white woman with long blonde hair in a black cowboy hat holds a clear glass trophy as she speaks behind a lectern.

props.synopsis: The 31-year-old Louisiana native was the undisputed star of the night, where she also was named female vocalist of the year, won album of the year for Bell Bottom Country, and gave a fiery rendition of her song Wildflowers and Wild Horses.

title.children: Lainey Wilson wins five CMA Awards, including entertainer and album of the year

image.altText: A sign in an ALDI store saying "we support Aussie farmers".

props.synopsis: An independent audit of supermarket efforts to cut plastic waste has found ALDI is leading the charge, albeit slowly.

title.children: The top supermarket in Australia reducing plastics waste revealed in new report

image.altText: terrace houses in Sydney

props.synopsis: According to data from a flatmates listing service, more home owners are renting out spare rooms but demand for share house living is also soaring amid Australia's affordability crisis and extremely tight rental markets.

title.children: These are the suburbs where it's almost impossible to find a room in a share house

image.altText: Australian banknotes, mostly $50 bills, strewn over a flat surface.

props.synopsis: More than 800 large companies paid no tax in 2021-22, an Australian Taxation Office (ATO) report reveals. Here's the full ATO list.

title.children: Search through the ATO's full list of big companies that paid no tax last financial year

image.altText: A high-up view of a housing estate, with mountain in background

props.synopsis: While "some heat" could leave the market after the Reserve Bank lifted interest rates this week, for now, house prices have surpassed even the post-COVID records of early 2022.

title.children: Homes in almost every part of Queensland now worth more than ever before

image.altText: Brown bottles of Aspen Methadone Syrup lined up on a shelf

props.synopsis: The inquest into the death of a boy who drank orange juice mixed with methadone has raised questions about how prescriptions for the drug's use at home are issued.

title.children: Safety of 'takeaway' methadone scrutinised as inquest into 6yo boy's tragic death concludes

image.altText: Man clings to pole horizontally

props.synopsis: Simon Ferguson wraps himself around a silver pole and performs a horizontal body ripple. As a male pole dancer, he's in the minority and attracts increased attention, but more men are taking up the sport.

title.children: Simon is an 'extreme introvert' — yet finds pole dancing in front of a crowd surprisingly invigorating

image.altText: Woman in sag-aftra cap and green shirt pumps fist in air

props.synopsis: Screen Actors Guild-American Federation of Television and Radio Artists members walked off the job in mid-July, asking for better protections against AI and streaming concerns.

title.children: Actors' union announces tentative deal to end strike that shut down Hollywood

image.altText: soldiers walk through an alleyway between buildings, rubble and debris lining the ground, one of the buildings is badly damaged

props.synopsis: Gaza City is encircled by tanks and the skies above are full of planes and drones. Now, after inching cautiously around its outskirts, Israeli ground troops are going in, writes Eric Tlozek.

title.children: Israel's new assault on Gaza is like none other before it, but Hamas has been preparing its defence

image.altText: Against a large red rock, a man and woman and four young children, wearing neat casual clothes, stand close together smiling.

props.synopsis: When life wasn't quite working for Sydney parents of four Jodi and Daniel, they decided to take a road trip. It proved to be a life-changing act.

title.children: This family spent their house deposit on a family holiday. It changed their lives
